head.supplied: [We forwarded by last mail to Dr. Mueller a box of dried plants forwarded to us by Mrs. Wells, of Boxvale, York, ¶ WA. It is possible that the plants were collected by Julia Wells and forwarded by her...

div.p: From the Inquirer and Commercial News, Perth

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Letter not found. The text given here is from 'Dried plants for Dr. Mueller', Inquirer and commercial news (Perth, WA), 7 February 1872, p. 3.

p.seg: [We forwarded by last mail to Dr. Mueller a box of dried plants forwarded to us by Mrs. Wells, of Boxvale, York,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: WA. It is possible that the plants were collected by Julia Wells and forwarded by her mother, Susannah: the specimens in MEL collected from Boxvale listed in the Australasian Virtual Herbarium ( http://avh.ala.org.au , accessed 25 February 2018) are listed under 'Wells, J. S.', or 'Wells, J.'. See Maroske & Vaughan (2014), p. 138.

p.seg: and we shall be happy to attend to the forwarding of any others that may be sent to us. The parcels are franked by the Colonial Secretary, which of course relieves the senders of any expense of transit.]
